intro: Rhinanthus alpinus subvar. elatus, commonly known as the alpine yellow rattle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it partially relies on other plants for water and nutrients through its root system. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. This subvariety is particularly adapted to high-altitude environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
